content: 18 22 24 28 these are the other half of the sts from the leg pm pick up and k8 9 11 12 14 along the right edge of the garter stitch heel flap k5 6 7 7 8 you should now be at the beginning of the round at the center of the heel flap 42 48 58 62 72 sts © 2023 stephen west all rights reserved pattern for personal use only questions support@westknits com 3 photography by westknits version 1 toe pattern repeat round 1 using mc k1 ssk k10 12 16 18 22 k2tog k1 round 2 k to m slm k to m slm k to end of round pm k1 ssk k10 12 16 18 22 k2tog k1 28 32 40 round 3 k to 2 sts before m k2tog slm k to m slm ssk 44 52 sts k to end of round 2 sts decreased row 2 k all sts repeat rnds 2 & 3 of pattern repeat 4 5 6 6 7 more round 3 using mc k1 ssk k to 3 sts before m k2tog times you should have 32 36 44 48 56 sts on your k1 slm k1 ssk k to 3 sts before end of round k2tog k1 needle keep the beginning of round marker in place but 4 sts decreased you can remove the other 2 stitch markers next to the row 4 k all sts decrease locations repeat last 2 rnds 2 3 4 4 5 more times 16 16 20 foot 24 28 sts continue knitting the foot in the round until your sock reaches just below the top of your smallest toe then you should repeat round 3 only 1 1 2 3 3 more times 12 12 12 be ready for the toe decreases 12 16 sts remove the beginning of round marker k8 9 11 12 14 finishing pm this stitch marker is the new beginning of round marker graft the remaining sts together using kitchener stitch watch this westknits video to assist with the kitchener stitch technique https //youtu be/lbfhqa4l66e weave in ends and wet block the finished sock to smooth the fabric © 2023 stephen west all rights reserved pattern for personal use only questions support@westknits com 4 photography by westknits version 1
